sen.j: 凡海麁鎌（おおあまのあらかま、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: OAMA no Arakama (date of birth and death unknown) is a person in the Asuka period.
OAMA no Arakama (date of birth and death unknown) was a person who lived during the Asuka period.

sen.j: 大海蒭蒲とも書く。
sen.e: His name is written as 凡海麁鎌 or 大海蒭蒲.
sen.cmt: 比較しやすいように「凡海麁鎌」を追加して訳しました。

sen.j: 「凡海・大海」は旧仮名遣いでは、「おほあま」、「おほしあま」、あるいは「おほさま」と訓む。
sen.e: In old Japanese orthography, Oama (凡海 or 大海) is read 'Ohoama', 'Ohoshiama' or 'Ohosama.'
In the old Japanese syllabary system, Oama (凡海 or 大海) is pronounced 'Ohoama,' 'Ohoshiama' or 'Ohosama.'

sen.j: カバネははじめ連、後に宿禰。
sen.e: His kabane (hereditary title) was Muraji (one of the two highest such titles, later demoted to seventh highest of eight) and later was Sukune (third highest of the eight).
His kabane (hereditary title) was Muraji (one of the two highest such titles, later demoted to seventh highest of eight) and later changed to Sukune (third highest of the eight).
His kabane (hereditary title) was Muraji (one of the two highest such titles, later demoted to seventh highest of eight) and later changed to Sukune (third highest of the eight).

sen.j: 大海人皇子（後の天武天皇）の養育に関わり、大宝 (日本)元年（701年）に陸奥国の冶金に遣わされた。
sen.e: He was engaged in nurturing Prince Oama (later Emperor Tenmu) and was sent to Mutsu Province for metallurgical work in 701.
He was involved in the upbringing of Prince Oama (later Emperor Tenmu) and was sent to Mutsu Province for metallurgical work in 701.

sen.j: 位階は大宝元年当時で追大肆。
sen.e: His Ikai (court rank) was tsuidaishi (the thirty-ninth grade of tsuidai rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank, which corresponds to Juhachiinoge, Junior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade of Taiho Ritsuryo, Taiho Code) in 701.

sen.j: 凡海氏は摂津国を本拠にした氏族である。
sen.e: The Oshiama clan was based in Settsu Province.

sen.j: 大海人（おおあま）皇子の名は、凡海（おおあま）氏が皇子の養育にあたったことから付けられたと推定される。
sen.e: It is presumed that the name of Prince Oama was named after Oama as he was engaged in nurturing the prince.
It is presumed that Prince Oama was named after Oama as he was involved in the prince's rearing.

sen.j: 天武天皇13年（684年）12月に連姓の50氏が宿禰の姓を授けられた。
sen.e: In January, 684, 50 clans with the kabane Muraji were entitled to Sukune, which should be when Arakama's kabane was also changed from Muraji to Sukune as the Oshiama clan was one of the 50 clans.
In January, 684, 50 clans with the kabane Muraji were given the title Sukune.

sen.j: このとき凡海氏もその中にあったので、麁鎌もこの時に連から宿禰になったはずである。
sen.e: The Oama clan was among the 50, and therefore, Arakama's kabane should have also changed at this time.

sen.j: 史書の中で、蒭蒲（麁鎌）は2箇所に現われる。

sen.j: 『日本書紀』朱鳥元年（686年）9月27日条と、『続日本紀』大宝元年（701年）3月15日条である。
sen.e: In the article of September 27, 686 of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and in the article of March 15, 701 of "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued).

sen.j: 朱鳥元年9月27日に、同月9日に崩御した天武天皇の遺体を安置した殯の庭で、幾人もの官人が次々に誄を述べた。
sen.e: On October 22, 686, a number of government officials delivered shinobigoto (eulogies) one after another in the garden of mogari (funeral) where the corpse of the Emperor Tenmu who died on the 4th of the same month was placed.

On September 27, 686, a number of government officials delivered shinobigoto (eulogies) in the garden of mogari (funeral) where Emperor Tenmu, who passed on the 9th of the same month was laid to rest.

sen.j: その最初の人が大海宿禰蒭蒲で、壬生のことを誄した。
sen.e: The first one was OSHIAMA no Sukune Arakama, who delivered shinobigoto on Mibu.

sen.j: 壬生（みぶ）は養育のことである。

sen.j: この場合直接養育にあたった者としてではなく、大海人皇子と一緒に育った乳兄弟か、あるいは一族の代表として述べたものと思われる。
sen.e: In this case, it can be assumed that he delivered shinobigoto not necessarily as a rearer, but as a foster brother who had grown up with Prince Oama or just as a representative of his family.

sen.e: Judging from this situation, it can be assumed that he was not in a position of raising the prince, but was rather a foster brother who was raised alongside the prince, or a representative of the family who expressed his grief.

sen.j: 大宝元年3月15日に、陸奥国に金を冶すために遣された。
sen.e: On May 1, 701, he was sent to Mutsu Province for metallurgical work.
